intro: Cynanchum acutum var. monspeliacum, commonly known as the Spanish milkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It belongs to the Asclepiadaceae family, which is characterized by its milky sap and showy flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with opposite, lanceolate leaves and clusters of fragrant, yellowish-green flowers. It thrives in dry, rocky soils and is often found in Mediterranean climates. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
